content.description: A decent super easy climb.  Has a good view when you top out.
content.location: This climb is located to the right of summit route.   It has massive jugs so you should not miss it

content.description:
Start as for The Seam and branch out left doing a cruxy shoulder move. Is V12/13 is the Bay Area Rock guidebook.

Check out these videos for more beta:

Kiernan Tong on

the send

Michael Glueck
content.protection: At least 4 pads. Be carefull of the rock to the side, bec you could hit it if you fell on the crux.
content.location: To the left of The Seam.

content.description:
Walk up the stairs, then boulder to the highest point of Indian Rock.

Easy warm-up climb leading to a spectacular view of the bay.
content.protection: Spotter(s) highly recommended, a fall a few feet backwards to the gap in the boulders or down the stairs could be quite dangerous.
content.location: The very top, on the north side. Walk up stone stairs to get there then turn left.

content.description: The stand start to the seam
content.protection: Have a good spotter.  You also might need to pad stack to reach the start
content.location: On the I block near the Seam.

content.description: Sit start matched on the low crimp. Make a few moves to gain a right hand finger lock in the crack. Don't fall while topping out.
content.location: The problem faces the street and is located on the suspended boulder above "The Pit". So instead of walking down the stairs, go slightly left and up the rock.

content.description: Go up the obvious some what wide crack left of under the skin. Try not to fall on the block traverse rock
Start at the notch and traverse into the middle of the I-Block and go up. First ascent was an onsight free solo by Royal Robbins right after he had soloed I-12

I-12 ascends the right side of the steep, Southwest face of the I boulder. The problem is done by first stemming the notch, then traversing left along the foot ledge, and then by ascending the shallow corner. I12 can top roped using the bolts on top, or soloed.
content.protection: Bolts on top if you want em'.
content.location: At the top of the Watercourse, please step (climber's) left.

climbs.name: I-11
climbs.fa: I wanna say Dick Leonard since he did the fa on I-12

content.description: Start in the are that you start for “The Edge” go up and onto the I-12 block there’s a big hold thing kind of poking out climb up to that and use it to go up. Exit left.
content.protection: Bolts on top or solo it

content.description: High ball traverse lots of moss and some holds have dirt in them.  This climb has a super nice view.
content.location: you can downclimb on the I block to reach the start then go right to left.  You can also do the seam stand then go left to right.

content.description:
Sit start to Couch Surfer. Start on a pretty small 2 finger edge on the left and a hand compressing on the right. We don’t know about any previous ascents but if you do know about the FA, name and grade comment below.

The only person I know that has sent is my buff friend Wyatt.
content.location: When at the Water Fountain Wall to your right and a bit up is a compression boulder that’s it.

content.description: Low/sit start hugging arete on lowest possible holds, then straight up the arete. Movement (arete slapping and hugging) feels like Static Reach @Catle Rock. Stand Start is listed in guidebook as V2. Potential sit start V9 or V10 ish.
content.location: To the right and down from the Summit Route.

content.description: A great little traverse when the Pit starts to get you down. Can be an ankle breaker, so bring a pad.
content.location: On the squarish block about the Overhang. Start on the left and work right. Nice reach at the end.

content.description: Start on the two blocky holds of the block traverse.  The you just go straight up the crux is manteling over onto the slaby bit.
content.location: It on the boulder that has the block traverese.  It near the seam also

content.description:
Sit-start with double hands on flat shelf right of `The Seam.' Move up through good grips & the arête and press out to the juggy lip to finish on the upper slab.

youtube.com/watch?v=LYsZbl_…
